note:
在因天气问题、技术问题，甚至附近一艘船导致的航程违规而取消了几次尝试后，SpaceX于周四成功地对其最新的星际飞船原型进行了静火测试。
德克萨斯州南部当地时间下午3点02分，连接到名为序列号5(SN5)的星际飞船原型上的单个猛禽发动机咆哮了几秒钟。在NASASpaceflight.com分享的视频中，这次测试似乎是名义上的，显然为SpaceX工程师提供了他们对最新一代星际飞船所需的信心。
测试结束后不久，SpaceX的创始人兼总工程师埃隆·马斯克(Elon Musk)证实，静态火灾意味着该公司现在计划推进该飞行器的短期试飞。根据美国联邦航空管理局的通知，这次150米的飞行测试最快可能在周日进行，发射窗口将在当地时间上午8点(协调世界时13点)打开。
这将是自2019年8月下旬粗壮的原型-StarHopper-飙升至150米以来，星际飞船硬件的首次飞行测试。在那次测试中，一台猛禽发动机在着陆前向上和横向驱动车辆约100米，成功地展示了甲烷燃料发动机的推力和矢量控制。
从那时起，SpaceX已经建造了几个全尺寸的原型，它们输给了一系列不同的燃料和压力测试。有了像SpaceX用于开发星际飞船这样的迭代测试计划，该公司选择接受一些合理的风险水平，以便快速行动。
而SpaceX一直在做这件事。在过去的八个月里，它在南得克萨斯州建立了一家令人印象深刻的工厂，并开始大量生产星际飞船原型。该公司的工程师和技术人员已将建造一艘星际飞船的时间从几个月减少到几周，使该公司更接近马斯克的最终目标：批量生产大型星际宇宙飞船，有朝一日人类可能会在火星上定居。
就在SpaceX一直在试验台上测试SN5的同时，现场还有几个未来原型的硬件，包括将使用新的、更坚韧的钢合金的型号。最终，SpaceX公司计划将后一种原型之一跃升至约20公里，可能是在今年晚些时候。
在此之后，该公司预计将专注于完成发射系统的第一阶段，这是一种名为“超重型”的火箭，将用于将“星际飞船”送入近地轨道。
note_en:
After scrubbing several attempts for weather concerns, technical issues, and even a range violation due to a nearby boat, SpaceX succeeded in static-fire testing the latest prototype of its Starship vehicle on Thursday.
 At 3:02pm local time in South Texas, the single Raptor engine attached to the Starship prototype dubbed Serial Number 5, or SN5, roared to life for a few seconds. In video  shared by NASASpaceflight.com, the test appeared to be nominal, evidently providing SpaceX engineers with the confidence they need in the latest iteration of Starship.
  Shortly after the test, the founder and chief engineer of SpaceX, Elon Musk, confirmed that the static fire meant the company now plans to move forward with a short test flight of the vehicle. Based upon  a notification from the US Federal Aviation Administration, this 150-meter flight test could take place as soon as Sunday, with a launch window opening at 8am local time (13:00 UTC).
 This would be the first flight test of Starship hardware since a stubby prototype—Starhopper— soared to 150 meters in late August 2019. That test, in which a single Raptor engine powered the vehicle upward and laterally for about 100 meters before landing, was successful in demonstrating thrust and vector control of the methane-fueled engine.
  Since then, SpaceX has built several full-scale prototypes, losing them to a varying array of fueling and pressure tests. With an iterative test program like the one SpaceX is using to develop Starship, the company has chosen to accept some reasonable level of risk in order to move fast.
 And SpaceX has been doing just that. Over the last eight months, it has built an impressive factory in South Texas and has begun to churn out Starship prototypes. Its engineers and technicians have reduced the time to build a single Starship down from months to weeks, bringing the company closer to  Musk's ultimate goal of mass-producing the large, interplanetary spaceships that may one day allow humans to settle Mars.
  Even as SpaceX has been putting SN5 through its paces on the test stand, there are bits of hardware at the site for several future prototypes, including models that will use a new, tougher steel alloy. Ultimately, SpaceX plans to hop one of these latter prototypes to about 20km, perhaps later this year.
 After that point, the company is expected to focus on completing the launch system's first stage, a rocket named "Super Heavy" that will be used to loft Starship into low Earth orbit.
title: SpaceX完成星际飞船原型的静态射击，将进行下一步跳跃
title_en: SpaceX completes static fire of Starship prototype, will hop next

Apple’s latest earning report suggests that the company is thriving despite COVID-19, with revenue of $59.69 billion in the third quarter of its fiscal year. That’s significantly higher than the $52.25 billion expected by analysts, and it reflects 11% growth year over year.
  This isn’t the first time Apple has reported earnings since coronavirus became a part of our lives, but Q3 was its first quarter to occur entirely during the pandemic.
 The company also announced a four-for-one stock split scheduled for the end of August, through which Apple investors will receive three more shares for each share they already own, with single shares becoming correspondingly more affordable.
  Amazon says police demands for customer data have gone up — The figures show that in the first half of 2020, Amazon received 23% more subpoenas and search warrants compared to the first half of 2019.
 PayPal and Venmo QR Code checkout is coming to 8,200 CVS stores in Q4 — CVS will become the first nationwide retailer to allow customers to pay using either their PayPal or Venmo QR code at the register, without fees.
 Google is making autofill on Chrome for mobile more secure — The new autofill experience on mobile will use biometric authentication for credit card transactions.
  Impossible Foods starts selling in Walmart and expands distribution of its new sausage product — Impossible Foods will now be available at more than 2,000 Walmart stores across the country.
 Rocket launch startup Astra readies for orbital test flight as early as Sunday — The startup only incorporated three years ago, and it’s building its rockets in Alameda, California.
 We’ve updated The TechCrunch List with 116 new VCs ready to write first and lead checks into startups — Thanks to reader response and recommendations, the list keeps growing!
  Six leading investors assess the remote-work startup landscape — In our latest VC survey, we try to understand if SaaS fatigue is real and where open-space still exists in the remote-work world.
 Four keys to building your startup — Insights from Sequoia’s Jess Lee, Initialized’s Garry Tan, Floodgate’s Ann Miura-Ko and Neo’s Ali Partovi.
 Jesus, SaaS and digital tithing — Part 1 of a series on “church tech.”
 (Reminder: Extra Crunch is our subscription membership program, which aims to democratize information about startups.  You can sign up here.)
  NASA successfully launches its Mars 2020 Perseverance rover using an Atlas V rocket — The Perseverance rover is equipped with sensors specifically designed to help it find evidence of ancient, microbiotic life on Mars.
 CBS All Access adds 3,500 new episodes before rebranding in 2021 — ViacomCBS had previously announced plans to launch an expanded and rebranded version of CBS All Access this summer, to better compete against streaming offerings like Disney+ and HBO Max.

title: Daily Crunch：苹果第三季度业绩超出预期

note:
四个多世纪以来，考古学家和地质学家一直试图确定几千年前用于建造巨石阵的石头的地理来源。事实证明，要确定构成纪念碑主体的大型石块的来源尤其难以捉摸。现在，研究人员解开了这个谜团：巨石阵现存的52个莎士比亚中，有50个来自英国威尔特郡的西伍兹遗址，位于巨石阵以北25公里处。这项研究结果发表在周三的“科学进展”杂志上。
地质学家经常可以利用岩石的宏观和微观特征来将它们与它们所在的露头相匹配。这样的技术使研究人员能够确定巨石阵的许多较小的“蓝石”是从威尔士西南部运来的。但研究合著者凯蒂·惠特克说，“萨森石的问题是，它们都是一样的。”惠特克是英国雷丁大学的研究生，也是历史英国公司的助理挂牌顾问。当你在显微镜下观察时，你会看到石英砂颗粒与更多的石英粘在一起。因此，研究小组求助于x射线荧光光谱法，这是一种非破坏性的技术，可以用x射线轰击样本，并分析样本作为反应发出的光的波长，这可以显示其化学组成。这项技术揭示了巨石阵表面存在的微量元素，或者说那些微量的元素。几乎所有这些石头的化学成分都非常相似，这表明它们是一起起源的。然而，这些数据不足以确定来源在哪里。
该团队的突破出人意料地出现在2018年，当时在1958年的一次修复项目中，从巨石阵的一个莎士比亚钻出的样本岩芯在私人收藏了60年后被送回了英国。研究人员获准销毁部分核心，以便进行更详细的分析。“我们兴奋得悄悄地跳上跳下，”英国布莱顿大学的自然地理学家、主要作者大卫·纳什(David Nash)说。使用两种类型的质谱，研究小组测定了核心中22种微量元素的水平，并将它们与散布在英格兰南部20个不同地点的萨森样本中的水平进行了比较。核心的化学特征与其中一个地点的化学特征完全匹配-西部森林，它覆盖了大约6平方公里。
英国南安普顿大学的考古学家约书亚·波拉德(Joshua Pollard)没有参与这项新的研究，他说，这一发现“看起来相当有说服力，也相当有说服力”。“这是一项重大成就。”他补充说，西伍兹位于肯内特河以南，在考古研究中经常被忽视。到目前为止，盛行的猜测一直认为莎士比亚起源于河的北面，在马尔伯勒唐斯(Marlborough Down)。
尽管纳什的团队确定了50个莎士比亚的起源，但最后两个-斯通26和斯通160-与研究的地点中的任何一个都不匹配，也不相互匹配。因为自从巨石阵建造以来，又损失了多达30个沙皇，所以不可能知道26号和160号巨石是独一无二的，还是从西森林之外带来的一大群岩石的残留物。
对纳什来说，这一发现最耐人寻味的暗示是，西伍兹的石头很可能都是在公元前2500年左右纪念碑第二阶段建造期间移动的。“它真正带给我的是在相当短的时间内建造这个结构所付出的巨大努力，”他说。新石器时代的人们是如何设法运输这些平均重量为20吨的巨型石头的，目前尚不清楚。但考古学家一致认为，大规模的社会协调是必要的。
未来的研究将试图揭开巨石阵建造者用来运输石头的路线。纳什团队首创的地球化学技术可以在英格兰的其他史前纪念碑上产生深刻的见解。“有无穷无尽的问题，无穷无尽的领域需要进一步的调查和思考，”波拉德说。“这是一段不会结束的旅程。”
note_en:
For more than four centuries, archaeologists and geologists have sought to determine the geographical origins of the stones used to build Stonehenge thousands of years ago. Pinning down the source of the large blocks known as sarsens that form the bulk of the monument has proved especially elusive. Now researchers have  resolved the mystery: 50 of the 52 extant sarsens at Stonehenge came from the  West Woods site in the English county of Wiltshire, located 25 kilometers to the north of Stonehenge. The findings were published on Wednesday in  Science Advances.
  Geologists can often use macroscopic and microscopic features of rocks to match them to the outcropping from which they were taken. Such techniques have allowed researchers to determine that many of Stonehenge’s smaller “bluestones”  were brought from southwestern Wales. But “the trouble with sarsen stone is that it’s all the same,” says study co-author Katy Whitaker, a graduate student at the University of Reading in England and an assistant listing adviser at Historic England. “When you look at it under the microscope, you see quartz sand grains stuck together with more quartz.” So the team turned to x-ray fluorescence spectrometry, a nondestructive technique that bombards a sample with x-rays and analyzes the wavelengths of light that sample emits in response, which can show its chemical makeup. The technique revealed the presence of trace elements, or those found in minute quantities, on the surface of Stonehenge’s sarsens. Almost all of those stones shared a remarkably similar chemical composition, indicating that they originated together. The data were insufficient to pinpoint where that source was, however.
    The team’s breakthrough came unexpectedly in 2018, when a sample core that had been drilled from one of Stonehenge’s sarsens during a 1958 restoration project  was returned to England after it spent 60 years in a private collection. The researchers were granted permission to destroy part of the core for a more detailed analysis. “We quietly jumped up and down with excitement,” says lead author David Nash, a physical geographer at the University of Brighton in England. Using two types of mass spectrometry, the team determined the levels of 22 trace elements in the core and compared them with the levels in sarsen samples from 20 different sites dotting southern England. The chemical signature of the core exactly matched that of one of the sites—West Woods, which encompasses about six square kilometers.
  The finding “looks to be fairly convincing and fairly conclusive,” says Joshua Pollard, an archaeologist at the University of Southampton in England, who was not involved in the new research. “It’s a major achievement.” Located just south of the River Kennet, West Woods has often been overlooked in archaeological research, he adds. Until now the prevailing speculation had posited that the sarsens originated to the north of the river, in the Marlborough Downs.
  Although Nash’s team identified the origin of 50 sarsens, the last two—Stone 26 and Stone 160—did not match any of the sites studied, nor did they match each other. Because up to 30 more sarsens have been lost since the construction of Stonehenge, it is impossible to know if Stones 26 and 160 are unique or the remnants of a large group of the rocks brought from outside West Woods.
    For Nash, the most intriguing implication of the finding is that the stones from West Woods were likely all moved during the monument’s second phase of construction, around 2500 B.C. “What it really brings home for me is the Herculean effort that went into making this structure in a reasonably short time window,” he says. How Neolithic people managed to transport the massive stones—which have an average weight of 20 metric tons—remains unknown. But archaeologists agree that large-scale social coordination was necessary.
  Future research will seek to uncover the route that the builders of Stonehenge used to transport the stones. And the geochemical techniques pioneered by Nash’s team could yield insights at other prehistoric henge monuments in England. “There are endless questions, endless areas that need further investigation and thought,” Pollard says. “This is a journey that’s not going to end.”
title: 巨石阵起源之谜终于揭开
title_en: One Mystery of Stonehenge's Origins Has Finally Been Solved

note:
亚马逊云部门第二季度营收同比增长29%，原因是疫情冲击了它的一些大客户，包括Lyft。增速从第一季的33%放缓。
亚马逊网络服务在为第三方应用程序远程提供计算能力和数据存储方面处于领先地位。它已经成为在线服务数字供应链的主要组成部分，包括Intuit和Workday，以及包括赫斯(Hess)和凯洛格(Kellogg)在内的科技行业以外的公司。在过去的五年里，AWS的增长速度快于亚马逊的其他细分市场，并为亚马逊带来了大部分运营利润。但这一次，情况发生了变化。
AWS第二季营收总计108.1亿美元，低于FactSet调查分析师一致预期的110.2亿美元。这占亚马逊总收入的12%，低于去年同期的13%，原因是亚马逊在疫情爆发期间向客户发货。至少自2015年第一季度以来，AWS第一次不是增长最快的细分市场。亚马逊在一份声明中说，北美部门按年率计算增长了43%，亚马逊的国际部门增长了38%。
微软是AWS最接近的竞争对手，在上周发布的第二季度收益报告中表示，Azure公有云的营收增速从上一季度的59%降至47%。
AWS的营业利润总计33.6亿美元，增长58%，高于FactSet普遍预期的30.1亿美元。亚马逊约57%的运营利润来自AWS。该部门的营业利润率为31.1%，高于2018年以来的水平。
在本季度，AWS降低了承诺在一段时间内使用EC2计算实例的客户的成本，并宣布与一家名为Slake的客户达成协议，亚马逊员工将采用Slake的通信服务，而Slake将采用支撑亚马逊Chime通信产品的技术。
同样在本季度，亚马逊前副总裁和杰出工程师蒂姆·布雷(Tim Bray)表示，他希望看到AWS从亚马逊撤出，变成一家独立的公司。他发布了一份假想的新闻稿和常见问题文件，这是他想象中的公告。亚马逊员工经常执行编写这些文档的练习，以指导他们的工作，为产品介绍做准备。去年12月，AWS首席执行官安迪·贾西告诉CNBC的乔恩·福特，亚马逊不会在2020年剥离AWS。他说：如果真是这样，我会感到震惊。
note_en:
Amazon's cloud division grew its revenue by 29% year over year in the second quarter as the pandemic hit some of its large customers, including Lyft. Growth slowed from  33% in the first quarter.
 Amazon Web Services leads the market for remote delivery of computing power and data storage for third-party applications. It has become a major component of the digital supply chain for online services, including Intuit and Workday, along with companies outside the technology industry, including Hess and Kellogg. For the past five years AWS grew faster than Amazon's other segments and given Amazon the majority of its operating profit. But this time, things changed.
  AWS revenue totaled $10.81 billion in the second quarter, less than the $11.02 billion consensus among analysts polled by FactSet. That represents 12% of Amazon's total revenue, down from 13% in the year-ago quarter as Amazon shipped products to customers during the pandemic. For the first time at least since the first quarter of 2015, AWS wasn't the fastest growing segment. The North America segment grew 43% on an annualized basis, Amazon's international segment grew 38%, Amazon said in a  statement.
 In reporting its own second-quarter earnings last week,  Microsoft, which is AWS' closest competitor, said revenue growth from the Azure public cloud for the period  slowed to 47% from 59% one quarter earlier.
 Operating profit from AWS totaled $3.36 billion, up 58% and above the FactSet consensus estimate of $3.01 billion. Around 57% of Amazon's operating profit came from AWS. Operating margin for the segment was 31.1%, higher than it's been since 2018.
 In the quarter AWS  lowered the cost of EC2 computing instances for customers that commit to usage over a set period of time, and it  announced a deal with one customer,  Slack, that will see Amazon employees adopt Slack's communication service, while Slack will adopt the technology underlying Amazon's Chime communication product.
 Also in the quarter, Tim Bray, a former Amazon vice president and distinguished engineer, said he would like to see AWS  taken out of Amazon and turned into an independent company. He published a  hypothetical press release and frequently-asked-questions document that he imagined for an announcement like that. Amazon employees  often perform the exercise of writing those documents to guide their work in preparation for a product introduction. In December, AWS CEO Andy Jassy told CNBC's Jon Fortt that Amazon would not spin out AWS in 2020. "I would be shocked if that was the case," he said.
title: 自2015年以来，AWS首次不是亚马逊增长最快的细分市场，季度增长从第一季度的33%放缓至29%
title_en: For the first time since 2015, AWS wasn't Amazon's fastest growing segment, as quarterly growth slowed from 33% in Q1 to 29%

note:
谷歌云业务的强劲增长帮助Alphabet度过了一个充满挑战的季度，因为搜索和YouTube的广告收入难以反弹到疫情爆发前的水平。
2020年第二季度，包括谷歌云平台(Google Cloud Platform，GCP)和G Suite在内的谷歌云(Google Cloud)带来了30.07亿美元的收入，比去年同期的21亿美元和上一季度的27.7亿美元增长了43%。增长是由GCP基础设施产品以及数据和分析平台引领的。
谷歌首席财务官露丝·波拉特(Ruth Porat)表示，GCP保持了第一季度强劲的收入增长水平，收入增长再次大幅高于云计算总体水平。总体而言，谷歌云第二季度营收增幅低于第一季度，反映出G Suite的涨价幅度超过了去年4月的涨价幅度。G Suite在每个座位的平均收入以及座位增长方面保持了健康的增长，这还不包括那些利用我们的免费试用将员工转移到家里工作的客户。
虽然广告继续为谷歌带来最多的收入，但与2019年同期相比，这一数字大幅下降。第二季度，谷歌广告收入达到298.67亿美元，而2019年第二季度为324.94亿美元。
谷歌搜索和其他广告收入(不包括YouTube)也是如此，第二季度带来了213.2亿美元，低于去年同期的236.42亿美元。YouTube广告收入环比下降至38.12亿美元，但高于一年前的36.03亿美元。
至于Alphabet&#39；第二季度的整体业绩，稀释后每股收益为10.13美元，营收为382.9亿美元，同比下降2%。平均而言，华尔街预计第二季度每股收益为8.34美元，营收为373.6亿美元。
在Alphabet的登月其他博彩类别中，收入达到1.48亿美元，而运营亏损攀升至11.2亿美元。谷歌上个季度宣布，将在2020年剩余时间内减少招聘。第二季度末的员工人数为127,498人。
note_en:
Strong growth in Google's cloud business helped buoy an otherwise challenging quarter for Alphabet, as ad revenues across Search and YouTube struggle to rebound to pre-pandemic levels.
    For Q2 2020, Google Cloud -- which includes Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and G Suite -- brought in $3.007 billion, up 43% from $2.1 billion a year prior and $2.77 billion the previous quarter. The growth was led by GCP infrastructure offerings and the data and analytics platform.
 "GCP maintained the strong level of revenue growth it delivered in the first quarter, and its revenue growth was again meaningfully above cloud overall," said Google CFO Ruth Porat. "Overall, the lower Google Cloud revenue growth in the second quarter relative to the first quarter reflects the fact that G Suite lapped a price increase that was introduced in April last year. G suite maintained healthy growth in average revenue per seat as well as in seat growth which does not include customers who took advantage of our free trials as they shifted their employees to work-from-home."
 While Advertising continues to generate the most revenue for Google, the number is down significantly compared to the same period in 2019. In Q2, Google ad revenues came to $29.867 billion, compared to $32.494 billion in Q2 2019.
 The same goes for Google Search and other ad revenue (excluding YouTube), which brought in $21.32 billion in Q2, down from $23.642 billion during the year-ago period. Revenue for YouTube ads was down quarter-over-quarter to $3.812 billion but up from $3.603 billion a year ago.
    As for Alphabet's overall  Q2 results, diluted earnings per share came to $10.13 on revenue of $38.29 billion, down 2% year-over-year. On average, Wall Street was looking for Q2 earnings of $8.34 per share with $37.36 billion in revenue.
 In Alphabet's moonshot "Other bets" category, revenue came to $148 million while the operating loss climbed to $1.12 billion. Google announced last quarter that it would down hiring for the rest of 2020. The headcount at the end of the second quarter was 127,498.
title: 第二季度谷歌云收入增长43%，达到30亿美元，原因是G Suite在4月份提价，以及谷歌云平台的基础设施产品
title_en: Google Cloud revenue increased 43% to $3B in Q2, driven by G Suite's price increase in April and Google Cloud Platform's infrastructure offerings

note:
如果你想到薰衣草，普罗旺斯风景如画的紫色田野，你可能会想到法国。
它是罗马人最喜欢的一种香水，用于化妆品、香水，甚至在蜜蜂的帮助下用来酿造蜂蜜。
然而，近年来，东欧的前共产主义国家保加利亚已经超过法国，成为世界薰衣草油产量的领先者。
在保加利亚玫瑰谷的中心，巴尔干山脉的山脚下，塔尔尼切尼小村庄周围的田地每年晚春都会变成紫色。
与此同时，由于细菌感染，法国薰衣草生产在过去十年中遭受了巨大损失。
塔尼切尼埃尼奥·邦切夫(Enio Bonchev)精油蒸馏厂的老板菲利普·利西查罗夫(Filip Lissicharov)表示，需要有人填补这一空白。他于1992年接任，当时共产主义和国有制垮台，但这家企业是由他的家族在1909年创办的。
随着今年的鲜花继续收获，保加利亚的薰衣草种植传统可以追溯到20世纪初。
保加利亚农业领域非营利性研究组织InteliAgro的首席执行官尼古拉·瓦尔卡诺夫(Nikolay Valkanov)表示，保加利亚和法国以前曾互换位置，保加利亚在70/80年代是最大的薰衣草生产国。
保加利亚在2012年从法国手中夺回了桂冠，根据InteliAgro的数据，保加利亚的薰衣草种植园已经从十年前的不到五分之一扩大到180平方公里(69平方英里)。
中东欧智库社会经济研究中心(Case)的经济学家克里兹托夫·格洛拉奇(Krisztof Glowacki)表示，廉价劳动力、良好的气候和种植薰衣草的悠久传统是保加利亚的主要优势。
根据欧盟的数据，保加利亚的每小时劳动力成本在欧盟中最低，为6.00欧元(7美元；5.47 GB)，而法国为36.60欧元。
Glowacki先生说，这有助于保加利亚薰衣草油的价格不到法国同类油的一半。因此，随着法国产量的下降，他表示，保加利亚石油的更便宜成本对大型化妆品公司等买家具有吸引力。
在塔尼切尼，Lissicharov先生的公司现在正在蒸馏今年的花朵来生产薰衣草油。鲜花被蒸熟，这些水分被收集起来并浓缩成油。
然后，几乎所有的石油都将出口，该公司还生产的薰衣草水也将出口。后者是通过向水中加入鲜花并将其煮沸而产生的。
令人遗憾的是，我们99%的薰衣草产品用于出口。Lissicharov先生说，保加利亚仍然没有一个发达的化妆品工业，使用这种特殊的精油作为主要原材料。
根据保加利亚国家精油、香水和化妆品协会的数据，美国是世界上最大的薰衣草油消费国，但保加利亚出口的主要买家是德国、法国和奥地利。
薰衣草需要充足的阳光和排水良好的土壤才能生长良好。这种植物起源于地中海国家，因此在春末夏初需要20-30摄氏度的温度才能茁壮成长。
然而，有些品种可以在像英国这样的国家成功种植。最近有报道称，今年英国薰衣草油的销量大幅上升。
虽然劳动力成本确实对薰衣草油的价格起到了一定作用，但归根结底还是取决于它的质量。许多人说，法国的石油仍然是最好的。
法国精油专业间委员会主席、Distillerie des 4 Valees(Distillery Of The Four Valleys)所有者阿兰·奥巴内尔(Alain Aubanel)表示，虽然近年来法国的产量一直在增加，但他的重点是质量。
他表示：确实，就价格而言，我们无法与之竞争。然而，就质量、技术诀窍、可追溯性和适应土壤的品种而言，我们确实有一张重要的牌要打。
这就像葡萄酒一样。我们在法国使用的品种与保加利亚使用的品种不同。这里的气候不同，生产工艺也完全不同。
英国香水和调味品公司Treatt的全球分析科学经理特雷西·史密斯(Tracey Smith)表示，在气味方面，法国油被认为具有花香、水果和樟脑的气味，并带有甘草的芳香。
保加利亚的油有时可以用花香和水果味来形容，但不那么新鲜，带有一点刺耳的青草味。最高等级的AOP法国薰衣草必须种植在海拔800米以上。
史密斯女士补充说，由于价格原因，她的公司购买的保加利亚薰衣草比法国薰衣草多得多。
如果你要创造一种很好的香水，那么你会想要最好的薰衣草。如果你想用手洗香水，那么保加利亚薰衣草是不错的，而且便宜得多。
智库经济学家格洛瓦奇表示，对薰衣草产品的需求可能取决于人们对补充医学和芳香疗法的兴趣。
尽管如此，他认为保加利亚工资上涨的趋势将逐渐降低那里薰衣草种植的利润。从长远来看，他认为气候变化是一种风险，因为薰衣草是一种敏感的作物。
然而，他说，该部门的社会意义[比长期的气候问题]要高得多，因为它为欠发达地区提供了获得收入的机会。
note_en:
If you think of lavender, the picturesque purple fields of Provence, France might spring to mind.
 A favourite scent of the Romans, it's used for cosmetics, fragrances, and even - with the help of bees - to make honey.
 However, in recent years, Bulgaria, the former communist country in Eastern Europe, has overtaken France to become the world leader in lavender oil production.
 In the heart of Bulgaria's Rose Valley, in the foothills of the Balkans mountain range, the fields around the small village of Tarnicheni turn purple every late spring.
 Meanwhile, French lavender production has suffered big losses in the past decade,  due to a bacterial infection.
   "Somebody needed to fill the gap," says Filip Lissicharov, the owner of the Enio Bonchev essential oil distillery in Tarnicheni. He took over in 1992, following the fall of communism and state ownership, but the business was set up by his family in 1909.
 With this year's crop of flowers now continuing to be harvested, Bulgaria's tradition of lavender cultivation dates back to the beginning of the 20th Century.
 "Bulgaria and France have changed places before, with Bulgaria being the largest producer of lavender back in the 70s/80s," says Nikolay Valkanov, chief executive at InteliAgro, a Bulgarian non-profit research group in the agriculture field.
 Bulgaria snatched the crown back from France in 2012, and its lavender plantations have expanded to cover 180sq km (69sq miles) from less than a fifth of that a decade ago, according to InteliAgro,
  Cheap labour, a good climate and a long tradition of growing lavender are Bulgaria's main advantages, says Krisztof Glowacki, economist at the Center for Social and Economic Research (Case), a think tank in Central and Eastern Europe.
 Bulgaria has the lowest  hourly labour costs in the European Union, at €6.00 ($7; £5.47), compared to €36.60 in France, according to EU figures.
 Mr Glowacki says this helps to make Bulgarian lavender oil less than half the price of its French equivalent. So as French production has fallen, he says that the cheaper cost of Bulgarian oil has been attractive to buyers such as large cosmetics companies.
 In Tarnicheni, Mr Lissicharov's firm is now distilling this year's flowers to produce the lavender oil. The flowers are steamed, and this moisture is collected and concentrated to form the oil.
 Almost all of the oil will then be exported, as will the lavender water that the company also makes. The latter is produced by adding flowers to water, and bringing it to the boil.
  "Regretfully 99% of our lavender production goes for export. Bulgaria still does not have a well-developed cosmetics industry which uses this particular essential oil as a main raw material," says Mr Lissicharov.
 The US is the world's largest consumer of lavender oil, but the main buyers of Bulgaria's exports are Germany, France and Austria, according to the Bulgarian National Association of Essential Oils, Perfumery and Cosmetics.
 Lavender needs full sun and well-drained soil to grow well. The plant originated from Mediterranean countries, so it requires temperatures of 20-30C during late spring and early summer to thrive.
 Some varieties can, however, be successfully grown in countries like the UK. And it was recently reported  that sales of English lavender oil have risen sharply this year.
 Although labour costs do play a part in the price of lavender oil, ultimately it comes down to its quality. And many say that French oil remains the best.
 Alain Aubanel, president of the Interprofessional Committee of French Essential Oils and owner of Distillerie des 4 Valees (Distillery of the Four Valleys), says that while production in France has been increasing in recent years, his focus is on quality.
 "It is true that in terms of prices, we can't compete," he says. "Nevertheless, in terms of quality, know-how, traceability, and the varieties adapted to the soil, there we really have an important card to play.
 "It's like for the wine. The varieties we use in France are not the same as the ones used in Bulgaria. It's not the same climate, and the production process is also totally different."
   "On odour, the French oil is considered to have a floral, fruity, camphoraceous odour with an aromatic liquorice type top note," says Tracey Smith, global analytical sciences manager at Treatt, a fragrance and flavourings firm in the UK.
 "The Bulgarian oil can sometimes be described as floral and fruity, but less fresh with a slightly harsh grassy top note. The highest grade AOP French fine lavender must be grown a minimum of 800m above sea level."
 Ms Smith adds that her firm buys much more Bulgarian lavender than French because of the price.
 "If you are going to create a fine fragrance, then you would want the best lavender. If you are creating a fragrance for a hand wash, then Bulgarian lavender is fine, And it is much, much cheaper."
       "The demand for lavender products may depend on interest in complementary medicine, and aromatherapy," says Mr Glowacki, the think tank economist.
 Nevertheless, he thinks that the trend of increasing salaries in Bulgaria will gradually make lavender cultivation there less profitable. And in the longer term, he sees climate change as a risk, since lavender is a sensitive crop.
 "However," he says, "the social significance of the sector is much higher [than longer term climate concerns], as it offers an opportunity in less developed regions to gain income."
title: 成功的甜蜜气味：保加利亚如何在薰衣草领域领先
title_en: The sweet smell of success: How Bulgaria took the lead in lavender

note:
在为期一天的国会听证会之后，这四家公司强调了竞争，淡化了自己的市场地位，结果是响亮的。该集团收集的收益节拍尤其令人印象深刻，因为它们是在经济收缩的季度出现的，这意味着它们在美国经济中的相对份额合计在此期间大幅上升。
让我们各自聊聊，以收集高水平的业绩，并关注苹果的股票拆分消息，这肯定会让华尔街在接下来的几天里一直在谈论。
苹果公布2020年第二季度营收为597亿美元，同比增长11%。这超出了预期，根据雅虎财经(Yahoo Finance)的平均水平，华尔街预计为522.5亿美元。
这家硬件和软件巨头还公布每股收益(GAAP，摊薄后)为2.58美元，较上年同期增长18%。根据雅虎财经(Yahoo Finance)的数据，这也超出了预期，投资者预计再次缩水2.04美元。
库比蒂诺宣布，它将把股票一分为四，苹果公司表示，这将使其“股票更容易为更广泛的投资者所接受”。在分数股投资的时代，这一举动感觉有点无意义。然而，道琼斯工业股票平均价格指数(Dow Jones Industrial Average)是按价格加权的，而苹果是一个成分股，所以这可能与选择有关。
苹果股价在正常时间上涨超过1点后，在盘后交易中上涨了4.7%。
Alphabet的情况稍微复杂一些，该公司实际上与去年同期相比出现了萎缩，尽管仍好于预期。
这家搜索巨头公布2020年第二季度营收为383亿美元，高于预期的373.6亿美元。由于Alphabet报告去年同期为389亿美元，今年Alphabet的规模小于去年同期。
该公司每股盈余也下滑，从上年同期的14.21美元降至每股10.13美元(GAAP，摊薄后)。然而，这又一次超出了8.34美元的预期结果。Alphabet的股价在发布报告后大致持平。
为什么它的股票在超出预期的情况下仍然下跌？因为收缩并不是很大，也可能是因为它的“其他押注”业务集合在本季度公布了11.2亿美元的负运营收入，这一结果比2019年第二季度的记录还要糟糕。那是一笔很大的费用。
亚马逊本季度表现出色，营收为889亿美元，高于去年同期的634亿美元，也高于预期的815.3亿美元。
根据雅虎财经的数据，该公司还设法实现了每股10.30美元(GAAP，稀释后)，远远超出了1.46美元的预期结果。
对亚马逊不利的唯一可能标志是，该公司的云计算服务AWS当季仅增长29%。这比它在2020年第一季度记录的33%要慢，而且，正如CNBC所指出的，比微软的竞争对手Azure产品在最近发布报告时管理的速度要慢得多。
尽管如此，亚马逊的股价在正常交易中上涨0.6%后，在盘后交易中上涨了约4.9%。
Facebook的季度对那些试图推动这家社交巨头改变其内容政策的人来说，是一个延伸的手指。该公司公布营收为187亿美元，较上年同期的169亿美元增长11%。投资者此前预计营收仅为174亿美元。
不出所料，在营收强劲的背景下，Facebook的每股收益超出了预期，每股利润为1.80美元，比去年同期的每股0.91美元增长了近100%，远远高于预期的1.39美元。
Facebook股价在盘后交易中上涨近6.5%，此前在常规交易中上涨约0.5点。
可恶，在数百万人失业的情况下，科技是否比其他经济领域做得更好，国会无法确定在全球大流行和经济危机期间支持本国民众是不是一个好主意。这些结果完全无助于打消人们对大型科技公司规模过大的担忧。
note_en:
Coming on the heels of a  day’s worth of congressional hearings in which the four companies highlighted competition and downplayed their market position, the results are loud. The group’s collected earnings beats are especially impressive given that they came during a quarter in which  the economy contracted, meaning that their combined, relative share of the U.S. economy went up sharply during the period.
 Let’s chat about each to collect high-level results, and check in on  Apple’s   stock-split news that is sure to keep Wall Street talking for days to come.
   Apple  reported Q2 2020 revenue of $59.7 billion, up 11% from the year-ago period. This was ahead of expectations, with the street anticipating $52.25 billion, according  to Yahoo Finance averages.
 The hardware-and-software giant also reported earnings per share (GAAP, diluted) of $2.58, up 18% from the year-ago quarter. This also beat expectations, with investors expecting a slimmer $2.04, again, according to Yahoo Finance data.
 And Cupertino announced that it will split its stock four for one, something that Apple said that will make its “stock more accessible to a broader base of investors.” In the age of fractional-share investing, the move feels somewhat meaningless. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, however, is price-weighted, and Apple is a component, so perhaps that has something to do with the choice.
 Apple shares are up 4.7% in after-hours trading, after gaining more than a point during regular hours.
    Alphabet   is a slightly more complicated story, with the company actually shrinking on a year-over-year basis, though still besting expectations.
 The search giant  reported $38.3 billion in revenue in Q2 2020, ahead of an  expected result of $37.36 billion. As Alphabet reported $38.9 billion in the year-ago quarter, Alphabet was smaller this year than the last.
 The company’s earnings per share also fell, from $14.21 in the year-ago quarter to $10.13 per share (GAAP, diluted). Again, however, that was ahead of an  expected result of $8.34. Shares of Alphabet are roughly flat after its report.
 Why is its stock down despite beating expectations? Because shrinking is not great, and perhaps because its “Other Bets” business collection posted negative operating income of $1.12 billion in the quarter, a worse result than it recorded in Q2 2019. That’s a big expense.
   Amazon   had a  killer quarter, including revenue of $88.9 billion, up from $63.4 billion in the year-ago quarter, and ahead of an  expected result of $81.53 billion.
 The company also managed to earn $10.30 per share (GAAP, diluted), far ahead of an expected result of $1.46,  per Yahoo Finance figures.
 The only possible mark against Amazon was that AWS, the company’s cloud computing service, only grew 29% in the quarter. That was slower than the 33% it recorded during Q1 2020, and, as CNBC notes, was dramatically slower than what Microsoft’s competing Azure product managed when it reported recently.
 Still, shares of Amazon are up around 4.9% in after-hours trading, after gaining 0.6% during regular trading.
   Facebook’s   quarter was a single, extended finger at those trying to nudge the social giant into shaking up its content policies. The company  reported $18.7 billion in revenue, up 11% from its year-ago result of $16.9 billion. Investors had  expected just $17.4 billion in top-line.
 Unsurprisingly, off the back of that revenue beat, Facebook bested earnings per share expectations, reporting $1.80 in per-share profit, up nearly 100% from its year-ago result of $0.91 per share, and far ahead of an expected $1.39.
 Facebook shares are up nearly 6.5% in after-hours trading, after gaining about half a point during regular trading.
  Hot damn, is tech doing better than the rest of the economy as millions are out of work, and Congress can’t figure out if supporting its own population during a global pandemic and economic crisis is, you know, a good idea. These results will do precisely nothing to dampen concern that Big Tech is too big.
title: 大型科技公司粉碎了第二季度收益预期
title_en: Big tech crushes Q2 earnings expectations

note:
在苹果发布第三季度财报后的一次电话会议上，该公司首席财务官卢卡·马埃斯特里(Luca Maestri)表示，与2019年9月发布的iPhone11机型相比，苹果预计今年的新款iPhone“将在几周后上市”。这对苹果来说是极其罕见的举动，它通常甚至拒绝承认自己发布新产品的时间表，甚至连每年都会更新的iPhone也不愿承认。
IPhone推迟发布并非史无前例，2017年苹果iPhone X直到11月才发布。在设备发布后的几周内，该公司还经常以不同的发布节奏发布不同的iPhone机型。
周四，苹果分享了第三季度的季度收益结果，打破了华尔街的预期，营收为596.9亿美元，同比增长11%。冠状病毒的流行并没有打击苹果的股价或收入增长，但这一承认是一个迹象，表明苹果在9月份发布的另一款产品线上确实停止了势头。
note_en:
In a call following the release of Apple’s Q3 earnings, the company’s CFO Luca Maestri shared that compared to the September 2019 release of iPhone 11 models, Apple is expecting this year’s supply of new iPhones “to be available a few weeks later.” It’s an exceedingly rare move for the company, which generally refuses to even acknowledge its timeline for releasing new products, even the iPhone which refreshes annually.
 It is not unprecedented for the iPhone’s release to be delayed, in 2017 Apple’s iPhone X was not released until November. The company also often releases different iPhone models on a different release cadence in the weeks following the device announcements.
   On Thursday, Apple shared quarterly earnings results from the third-quarter which smashed Wall Street expectations delivering revenue of $59.69 billion, up 11 percent year-over-year. The coronavirus pandemic hasn’t knocked Apple’s share price or revenue growth, but the admission is one sign that it did halt momentum in its product pipelines in delivering another September release.
title: 苹果称下一代iPhone发布时间将晚于往常
title_en: Apple says next iPhones will launch later than usual

note:
Lyft租赁公司最初为洛杉矶和旧金山的人们提供了通过其应用程序租赁车辆的能力，这款应用程序传统上可能被用来叫车或抢占共享滑板车。试点取得了足够的成功，足以保证扩大规模，但有一个显著的变化。Lyft拥有并运营洛杉矶和旧金山的租赁车队。新的合作伙伴关系将把这一责任转移到Sixt，这是一家在美国拥有70多个分店的全球租车公司。Lyft表示，它将继续拥有和运营洛杉矶和旧金山的租赁机队。
通过Sixt合作伙伴关系提供的汽车租赁选项最初将扩展到拉斯维加斯、迈阿密和西雅图。Lyft表示，计划在未来几个月内将业务扩展到美国Sixt租赁网络内的所有城市。
客户可以打开Lyft应用程序，从“租赁”选项卡中找到可以直接租赁的汽车。从这里，用户可以选择他们的车辆类别、预订日期、位置和添加保险范围的选项。客户还可以选择他们的车辆的确切制造商和型号。Lyft表示，在将汽车放回Sixt停车场后，它将提供10美元的信贷用于叫车。
Lyft租车公司不应与该公司的Express Drive计划混淆，后者为想要在Lyft叫车应用上开车的人提供了一种使用车辆的方式。与赫兹合作的Express Drive针对的是司机。Lyft租赁是一种消费产品。
Lyft押注与Sixt的合作将使其能够迅速扩张，而不会承担购买、拥有和维护实际车辆的高昂资本成本，更不用说管理在城市和机场运营租车公司所需的各种许可证的负担了。
据Lyft称，Lyft将从通过该应用程序进行的每一次租赁中获得佣金。
note_en:
Lyft Rentals initially gave folks in Los Angeles and San Francisco the ability to rent vehicles through its app, which might be traditionally used to hail a ride or grab a shared scooter. The pilot was successful enough to warrant an expansion, but with one notable change. Lyft owns and operates the rental fleet in Los Angeles and San Francisco. The new partnership will shift that responsibility to Sixt, a global rental car company with more than 70 locations in the United States. Lyft said it will continue to own and operate the rental fleet in Los Angeles and San Francisco.
 The car rental option via the Sixt partnership will initially expand to Las Vegas, Miami and Seattle. Lyft said it plans to expand to all cities within the Sixt rental network in the U.S. in the coming months.
  Customers can open the Lyft app to find a selection of cars that can be rented directly from the “Rentals” tab. From here, users can select their vehicle class, reservation dates, location and an option to add insurance coverage. Customers also have the option to select the exact make and model of their vehicle. Lyft said it will provide a $10 credit to be used to hail a ride after dropping the car back at the Sixt lot.
  Lyft Rentals shouldn’t be confused with the company’s Express Drive program, which gives people who want to drive on the Lyft ride-hailing app a way to gain access to a vehicle. Express Drive, which is in partnership with Hertz, is aimed at drivers. Lyft Rentals is a consumer product.
 Lyft is betting that the partnership with Sixt will allow it to scale quickly without taking on the high capital costs of buying, owning and maintaining the actual vehicles, not to mention the burden of managing the various permits required to operate a rental car company in cities and at airports.
 Lyft will receive a commission from each rental made through the app, according to the company.
title: Lyft与Sixt合作扩大租赁业务
title_en: Lyft expands its rental business with Sixt partnership

note:
苹果周四公布了创纪录的6月份季度业绩，由于产品和服务都实现了两位数的增长，超过了市场预期。该公司的每个地理部门也都出现了增长。
这家库比蒂诺科技巨头公布第三季度每股收益为2.58美元，同比增长18%，营收为597亿美元，同比增长11%。
首席执行官蒂姆·库克在一份声明中表示，在不确定时期，这一业绩证明了我们的产品在客户生活中发挥的重要作用，也证明了苹果坚持不懈的创新精神。对于我们的社区来说，这是一个充满挑战的时刻，从苹果公司(Apple)新推出的1亿美元种族公平和正义倡议到到2030年实现碳中性的新承诺，我们都在践行这样的原则：我们所做的和所做的应该创造机会，让世界变得比我们发现的更美好。
苹果公司还宣布董事会宣布公司普通股每股82美分的现金股息。此外，董事会批准了一项四送一的股票拆分计划，以使股票更容易为更广泛的投资者所接受。在8月24日收盘时，每位苹果股东在记录日期持有的每一股股票将获得三股额外的股票，8月31日将在拆分调整的基础上开始交易。
苹果活跃的设备安装基数在第三季度达到了历史最高水平，在其所有地理细分市场和主要产品类别中都是如此。
IPhone销售收入总计264亿美元，比2019年第三季度的259.8亿美元增长了2%。库克在周四的电话会议上表示，苹果在5月和6月的需求好于预期。他表示，造成这一结果的原因有很多，包括iPhone SE的强劲发布，持续的经济刺激，以及世界各地取消避难所限制可能带来的一些好处。
Mac总销售额为70.8亿美元，较上年同期的58.2亿美元增长22%。第三季度iPad销售额达到65.8亿美元，比去年同期的50.2亿美元增长了31%。库克说，尽管Mac和iPad产品的供应受到限制，但这两款产品的销售收入仍在增长，这突显出它们对于在家工作和学习变得多么不可或缺。
可穿戴设备、家庭和配件部门的收入为64.5亿美元，高于去年同期的55.3亿美元。苹果指出，可穿戴设备业务现在的规模相当于财富140强公司。Apple Watch继续扩大其与新客户的联系--在第三季度购买手表的客户中，超过75%的人是该产品的新客户。
第三季度服务收入达到131.6亿美元，比去年同期的114.6亿美元增长了15%。该公司提前六个月实现了2016财年服务收入翻一番的目标。
note_en:
Apple posted a  record June quarter on Thursday, eclipsing market estimates thanks to double-digit growth in both products and services. The company also saw growth in each of its geographic segments.
 The Cupertino tech giant reported Q3 earnings of $2.58 a share, up 18 percent year-over-year, on revenues of $59.7 billion, an increase of 11 percent over the year prior.
  "In uncertain times, this performance is a testament to the important role our products play in our customers' lives and to Apple's relentless innovation," CEO Tim Cook said in a statement. "This is a challenging moment for our communities, and, from Apple's new $100 million Racial Equity and Justice Initiative to a new commitment to be carbon neutral by 2030, we're living the principle that what we make and do should create opportunity and leave the world better than we found it."
 Apple also announced its board of directors declared a cash dividend of 82 cents per share of the company's common stock. Additionally, the board of directors approved a four-for-one stock split to make the stock more accessible to a broader base of investors. Each Apple shareholder at the close of business on August 24 will receive three additional shares for every share held on the record date, and trading will begin on a split-adjusted basis on August 31.
   Apple's active installed base of devices reached an all-time high in Q3, in all of its geographic segments and major product categories.
 Revenue from iPhone sales totaled $26.4 billion, up 2 percent from $25.98 billion in Q3 2019. Apple saw better-than-expected demand in May and June, Cook said on a Thursday conference call. The results were due to a number of causes, he said, including a strong  iPhone SE launch, continued economic stimulus, as well as potentially some benefit from shelter-in-place restrictions lifting around the world.
    Mac sales totaled $7.08 billion, up 22 percent from $5.82 billion a year prior. Third quarter iPad sales came to $6.58 billion, up 31 percent from $5.02 billion a year prior. Revenue from Mac and iPad sales grew in spite of supply constraints on both products, underscoring "how integral they have become to working and learning from home," Cook said.
 The Wearables, Home and Accessories segment brought in $6.45 billion, up from $5.53 billion a year prior. The Wearables business now the size of Fortune 140 company, Apple noted. Apple Watch continued to extend its reach with new customers -- over 75 percent of customers purchasing watch in Q3 were new to the product.
 Services revenue in Q3 came to $13.16 billion, up 15 percent from $11.46 billion a year prior. The company achieved its goal of doubling its fiscal 2016 services revenue six months ahead of schedule.
title: 苹果第三季度：服务达到创纪录的131.6亿美元，高于2019年第二季度的114.5亿美元，可穿戴设备、家庭和配件增长至64.5亿美元，而去年为55.3亿美元
title_en: Apple Q3: services hit all-time record of $13.16B, up from $11.45B in Q2 2019, as Wearables, Home and Accessories grew to $6.45B, compared to $5.53B last year

note:
苹果首席财务官周四表示，今年新款iPhone的到货时间将比往年晚几周，这证实了早先的新闻报道和供应商的评论。
重要原因：此举意味着一些通常在9月底到来的收入要到今年最后一个季度才会到来，但也让投资者和客户放心，延迟不会更久了。
财务长卢卡·马埃斯特里(Luca Maestri)在财报爆棚后的电话会议上表示，新款iPhone的供货时间将比去年晚几周，去年9月下旬新机型开始销售。
高通(Qualcomm)昨日表示，其5G旗舰产品推迟全球发布的一个关键客户将影响其业绩，因此推断至少有部分新款iPhone将像预期的那样支持5G是公平的。
总体情况：苹果没有给出当前季度的具体财务指引，但表示预计其Mac和iPad业务将继续保持强劲。在疫情肆虐和转向远程教育的背景下，上个季度这两项业务的增长更为强劲。
首席执行官蒂姆·库克在电话会议上表示：我们相信我们将迎来一个强劲的返校季节。
note_en:
Apple's financial chief said Thursday that this year's new iPhone models will arrive a few weeks later than they have in years past, confirming earlier news reports and supplier comments.
 Why it matters: The move means some revenue that typically comes at the end of September won't come until the final quarter of the year, but also reassures investors and customers that the delay won't be longer.
 In a conference call following  blowout earnings, CFO Luca Maestri said that supply of the new iPhones will come "a few weeks later" than last year, when the new models went on sale in late September.
 Qualcomm had said yesterday that its results would be impacted by a key customer having a delayed global launch for its 5G flagship, so it's fair to infer that at least some new iPhones will support 5G, as expected.
 The big picture: Apple didn't give specific financial guidance for the current quarter but said it expects continued strength in its Mac and iPad businesses which saw stronger growth last quarter, amid the pandemic and a shift to distance learning.
 "We believe we are going to have a strong back-to-school season," CEO Tim Cook said on the conference call.
title: 苹果证实，新款iPhone的到货时间将比过去几年晚几周，证实了早先的新闻报道和供应商的评论
title_en: Apple confirms new iPhone models will arrive a few weeks later than they have in years past, confirming earlier news reports and supplier comments

note:
百度的营收增长在2020年第二季度降温，但即便是新冠肺炎疫情肆虐的互联网视频平台实现了5.8%的同比增长。谷歌母公司公布营收下降2%，这是该公司有史以来首次营收下降，但仍高于华尔街的预期。
第二季度，YouTube的广告收入为38.1亿美元，高于去年同期的36亿美元。但这一时期的销售额低于第一季度的40.4亿美元，当时YouTube的广告收入猛增了33%。
谷歌“搜索与其他”收入同比下降9.8%，第二季度下降23亿美元至213.2亿美元。
Alphabet和谷歌首席财务官露丝·波拉特(Ruth Porat)在公司财报电话会议上表示，谷歌7月份的广告销售趋势出现了“温和”的改善，但考虑到宏观经济的不确定性，“现在说我们已经走出困境还为时过早”。
Alphabet的总收入为383亿美元(下降2%)，净收入为69.6亿美元(或每股10.13美元)，同比下降43%。分析师此前预计Alphabet第二季度营收为373.6亿美元，每股收益为8.34美元。
Alphabet/Google首席执行官桑达尔·皮查伊(Sundar Pichai)表示，在广告相对疲软的情况下，其他业务线-包括YouTube订阅、Google Play和Google Cloud-的增长帮助抵消了下降的影响。谷歌云业务的销售额跃升了43%，达到30.1亿美元。
皮查伊说：“随着人们越来越多地转向在线服务，我们的平台--从Cloud到Google Play再到YouTube--正在帮助我们的合作伙伴提供重要服务并支持他们的业务。”
note_en:
’s revenue growth cooled in the second quarter of 2020, but even with the COVID-19 pandemic  ’s internet video platform carved out year-over-year growth of 5.8%.  , Google’s parent company, posted a 2% decline in revenue — its first-ever revenue drop — while it still topped tempered Wall Street estimates.
 For Q2, YouTube’s ad revenue was $3.81 billion, up from $3.60 billion in the year-ago period. But sales for the period were  down from $4.04 billion in the first quarter, when YouTube’s advertising revenue boomed 33%.
 Google “Search & Other” revenue was down 9.8% year over year, dropping by $2.3 billion to $21.32 billion for Q2.
 Google saw a “modest” improvement in ad-sales trends in July, but “it’s premature to say we’re out of the woods” given macroeconomic uncertainty, Alphabet and Google CFO Ruth Porat said on the company’s earnings call.
  Alphabet overall posted $38.30 billion in revenue (down 2%) while net income of $6.96 billion (or $10.13 per share) represented a 43% year-over-year decline. Analysts had forecast Alphabet second-quarter revenue coming in at $37.36 billion with EPS of $8.34.
 Amid the relative advertising weakness, other lines of business — including YouTube subscriptions, Google Play and Google Cloud — grew to help offset the decline, according to Alphabet/Google CEO Sundar Pichai. Sales in the Google Cloud business jumped 43%, to $3.01 billion.
 “As people increasingly turn to online services, our platforms — from Cloud to Google Play to YouTube — are helping our partners provide important services and support their businesses,” Pichai said.
title: Alphabet报告YouTube广告收入为38.1亿美元，同比增长5.8%，但低于第一季度的40.4亿美元
title_en: Alphabet reports YouTube ad revenue of $3.81B, up 5.8% YoY, but down from $4.04B in Q1

note:
谷歌母公司Alphabet在上个季度警告称，预计第二季度业绩将受到冠状病毒的影响，事实的确如此：该公司出现了其历史上的首次收入下降。但它成功地超过了华尔街的营收预期。
该季度总收入为383亿美元，低于预期的374亿美元，但这标志着比2019年第二季度下降了2%。净利润从一年前的99亿美元降至69亿美元。搜索收入为213亿美元，低于236亿美元。
首席财务官露丝·波拉特(Ruth Porat)在宣布财报的声明中表示：“我们继续在艰难的全球环境中导航。”
其中一个亮点是YouTube，其广告收入从去年的36亿美元增至38.1亿美元。谷歌云部门的收入也在增长，从去年同期的21亿美元增至30.1亿美元。
在与分析师的电话会议中，Porat表示，她对公司在接近6月30日结束的季度末的增长感到“谨慎的鼓舞”，但补充说，“鉴于全球宏观环境的明显不确定性，我们认为现在衡量近期趋势的持久性还为时过早.”
首席执行官桑达尔·皮查伊(Sundar Pichai)在电话会议上表示，尽管由于冠状病毒大流行，经济环境仍然脆弱，但“随着用户重返在线商业活动，我们看到了企稳的早期迹象。”
Alphabet的其他押注类别-包括其实验性X实验室、Waymo自动驾驶子公司，以及其他一些部门，如其Verely生命科学部门-的收入从一年前的1.62亿美元下降到1.48亿美元。其他押注出现了11.2亿美元的运营亏损。
谷歌的“其他收入”，包括硬件、Play Store和YouTube的非广告收入，从40亿美元上升到51.2亿美元。
当被问及针对谷歌搜索和安卓业务的反垄断调查时，皮查伊表示，该公司将“适应”，并补充说，“我认为审查还会持续一段时间。”
Alphabet是周四公布季度收益的四家科技巨头之一，也是唯一家业绩较去年同期有所下降的公司。它的股票在周四的盘后交易中小幅上涨。
note_en:
Google parent company Alphabet warned in last quarter that it was expecting to see the impact of coronavirus in the second quarter results, and it did: the company saw its first revenue decline in its history. But it managed to beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations.
 Total revenue for the quarter was $38.3 billion, versus the $37.4 billion expected, but that marks a 2 percent decline from the second quarter of 2019. Net income dropped to $6.9 billion, from $9.9 billion a year ago,. Revenue for Search was $21.3 billion, down from $23.6 billion.
 “We continue to navigate through a difficult global environment,” CFO Ruth Porat said in a statement announcing the earnings.
 One bright spot was YouTube, where advertising revenue rose to $3.81 billion, from $3.6 billion last year. Google’s Cloud division saw rising revenue as well, to $3.01 billion from $2.1 billion in the year ago quarter.
 During a call with analysts, Porat said she was “cautiously encouraged” by the company’s growth near the end of the quarter, which ended June 30th, but added “we believe it its premature to gauge the durability of recent trends given the obvious uncertainty of the global macro environment.”
 CEO Sundar Pichai said on the call that while the economic climate remained fragile due to the coronavirus pandemic, “we saw the early signs of stabilization as users returned to commercial activity online.”
 Revenue for Alphabet’s Other Bets category — which includes its experimental X lab, Waymo self-driving subsidiary, and a number of other divisions like its Verily life sciences unit was down, to $148 million from $162 million a year ago. Other Bets saw an operating loss of $1.12 billion.
 Google “other revenues,” which includes its hardware, Play Store, and non-advertising YouTube revenues — reported $5.12 billion, up from $4 billion.
 Asked about the  anti trust investigations into Google’s search and Android businesses, Pichai said the company would “adapt,” adding, “I think the scrutiny is going to be here for a while.”
 Alphabet was one of four tech giants reporting quarterly earnings on Thursday, and the only one whose results showed a decline from the year-ago quarter.  Its stock rose slightly in after-hours trading Thursday.
title: Alphabet的“其他赌注”，包括Waymo、Verely、Fibre和其他公司，第二季度营业亏损11.2亿美元，营收为1.48亿美元，低于去年同期的1.62亿美元
title_en: Alphabet's “Other Bets”, which includes Waymo, Verily, Fiber, and others, had a Q2 operating loss of $1.12B on revenues of $148M, down from $162M YoY

note: 超级NES上末日的源代码于2020年7月14日发布。在本期节目中，我们将仔细看看它的开发者兰迪·林登是如何……
note_en: The source code for DOOM on the Super NES was released on July 14th 2020. In this episode we take a closer look at how its developer Randy Linden was able to...
title: 深入了解Super NES Doom源代码发布[视频]
title_en: A Closer Look at the Super NES Doom Source Code Release [video]

note:
谷歌母公司Alphabet在上个季度警告称，预计第二季度业绩将受到冠状病毒的影响，事实的确如此：该公司出现了其历史上的首次收入下降。但它成功地超过了华尔街的营收预期。
该季度总收入为383亿美元，低于预期的374亿美元，但这标志着比2019年第二季度下降了2%。净利润从一年前的99亿美元下降到69亿美元。搜索收入为213亿美元，低于236亿美元。
其中一个亮点是YouTube，其广告收入从去年的36亿美元增加到今年的38.1亿美元。谷歌云部门的收入也在增长。
首席财务官露丝·波拉特(Ruth Porat)在宣布财报的声明中表示：“我们继续在艰难的全球环境中导航。”
Alphabet的其他押注类别-包括其实验性X实验室、Waymo自动驾驶子公司，以及其他一些部门，如其Verely生命科学部门-的收入从1.62亿美元下降到1.48亿美元。其他押注出现了11.2亿美元的运营亏损。
谷歌的“其他收入”，包括硬件、Play Store和YouTube的非广告收入，从40亿美元上升到51.2亿美元。
note_en:
Google parent company Alphabet warned in last quarter that it was expecting to see the impact of coronavirus in the second quarter results, and it did: the company saw its first revenue decline in its history. But it managed to beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations.
 Total revenue for the quarter was $38.3 billion, versus the $37.4 billion expected, but that marks a 2 percent decline from the second quarter of 2019. Net income dropped from $9.9 billion a year ago, to $6.9 billion. Revenue for Search was $21.3 billion, down from $23.6 billion.
 One bright spot was YouTube, where advertising revenue rose from $3.6 billion last year, to $3.81 billion this year. Google’s Cloud division saw rising revenue as well.
 “We continue to navigate through a difficult global environment,” CFO Ruth Porat said in a statement announcing the earnings.
 Revenue for Alphabet’s Other Bets category — which includes its experimental X lab, Waymo self-driving subsidiary, and a number of other divisions like its Verily life sciences unit was down, from $162 million to $148 million. Other Bets saw an operating loss of $1.12 billion.
 Google “other revenues,” which includes its hardware, Play Store, and non-advertising YouTube revenues — reported $5.12 billion, up from $4 billion.
title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet出现历史上首次营收下滑
title_en: Google parent company Alphabet sees its first revenue decline in history
